Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors

Class DataConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractDataConnector
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.DataConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectorI, DataConnectorI, ComponentInterface, DataOfferedCI.PushCI, DataRequiredCI.PullCI, RequiredCI
    public class DataConnector
extends AbstractDataConnector
    The class DataConnector partially implements a basic data connector where components call each others using plain Java method calls only.

    Description

    As there are two possible mode for transmitting data, push and pull, the connector establishes a two way connection between the two components, implementing the offering PushCI interface with methods calling the requiring PushCI and implementing the requiring PullCI interface with methods calling the offering PullCI one.

    The basic sequential data connector simply implements the offered push interface send signature by a method calling the corresponding required push interface signature receive that is then implemented by the requiring component. Conversely, this connector also implements the required pull interface request signature by a method that merely calls the corresponding offered pull interface get signature then implemented by the offering component. In both cases, the translating method from is called to translate the offered data type to the required one.

    To complete this class, a subclass has only to implement the setConnectorOnComponents method that is required when connecting the two components to allow them to register the connector when needed. In the case of the basic sequential data connector, both components need to register it to call it in both the push and pull modes.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
